title: How to Delete All Emails in Your Gmail Inbox at Once

steps.title: Log into Gmail.
steps.content: Log into Gmail. Open www.gmail.com in your desktop browser and log in to your account, if you haven't already done so.

steps.title: Click on v More from the left side menu.
steps.content: Click on v More from the left side menu. Then select All Mail from the list. If you want to delete emails by category, select one of the category tabs ( Social, Promotions, Updates, Forums ) from the top menu.

steps.title: Check the box at the top left to select all messages.
steps.content: Check the box at the top left to select all messages. It's next to the "Compose" button.

steps.title: Click on the “Select all conversations” link.
steps.content: Click on the “Select all conversations” link. It's displayed as Select all # conversations in All Mail at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click the “Delete” icon that resembles a grey bin, at the top of the page.
steps.content: Click the “Delete” icon that resembles a grey bin, at the top of the page. A confirmation box will pop up.

steps.title: Confirm your action.
steps.content: Confirm your action. Click the OK button in the confirmation box to delete all the conversations in your Inbox.

steps.title: Permanently delete your messages, if desired.
steps.content: Permanently delete your messages, if desired. Your deleted messages will move to the Trash bin. If you want to remove your emails from the bin, select Bin from the left side menu and click on the Empty Bin now link. Click OK button from the dialog box to confirm your action. You're done!
